definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat

sentences.english: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him
sentences.chinese: 说，谁是愚蒙人，可以转到这里来。

sentences.english: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
sentences.chinese: 愚蒙迷住孩童的心，用管教的杖可以远远赶除。

sentences.english: Foul and festering are my sores because of my folly.
sentences.chinese: 我的创痍溃烂流脓，完全由于我的愚蒙。

sentences.english: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him
sentences.chinese: 说，谁是愚蒙人，可以转到这里来。

sentences.english: Folly is bound up in the heart of a boy, nut the rod of discipline drives it far away.
sentences.chinese: 愚蒙迷住孩童的心，用管教的杖可以远远赶除。

definition: to lose one's way/to get lost (on the road etc)
to return to the right path/to mend one's ways/to reform/Reformed (church etc)
to warn/to admonish/variant of 針|针[zhen1]
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
